Experiment Method.Assay Method: Transgenic Drosophila model generation and phenotyping

Material used.Description: Transgenic flies expressing LRRK2 variants were generated and tested for neuronal and behavioral phenotypes.

Readout description.Result Description: LRRK2-G2019S variants caused dopaminergic neuron loss, locomotion deficits, and reduced lifespan in Drosophila.
LRRK2-Y1699C variants exhibited similar neuronal and behavioral defects as G2019S.
LRRK2-G2385R variants showed comparable neuronal and locomotor impairments.

Biological replicates.Description: Three biological replicates were performed for locomotion and lifespan assays.

Technical replicates.Description: Each experiment was repeated in triplicate for technical validation.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type LRRK2-expressing flies were used as a positive control for neuronal survival.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector-expressing flies were used as a negative control for baseline phenotypes.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA and Kruskal-Wallis tests were used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Dopaminergic neuron count â‰¥ 80% of wild-type controls.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Dopaminergic neuron count < 60% of wild-type controls.
